001package edu.pdx.cs.joy.whitlock;
002
003import org.junit.jupiter.api.Disabled;
004import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007
008import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
009import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.containsString;
010import static org.hamcrest.core.IsEqual.equalTo;
011import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertThrows;
012
013/**
014 * Unit tests for the Student class.  In addition to the JUnit annotations,
015 * they also make use of the <a href="http://hamcrest.org/JavaHamcrest/">hamcrest</a>
016 * matchers for more readable assertion statements.
017 */
018public class StudentTest
019{
020
021  @Test
022  void studentNamedPatIsNamedPat() {
023    String name = "Pat";
024    var pat = createStudentNamed(name);
025    assertThat(pat.getName(), equalTo(name));
026  }
027
028  private static Student createStudentNamed(String name) {
029    return new Student(name, new ArrayList<>(), 0.0, "Doesn't matter");
030  }
031
032  @Test
033  void allStudentsSayThisClassIsTooMuchWork() {
034    var student = createStudentNamed("Any name");
035    assertThat(student.says(), equalTo("This class is too much work"));
036  }
037
038  @Disabled
039  @Test
040  void daveStudent() {
041    ArrayList<String> classes = new ArrayList<>();
042    classes.add("Algorithms");
043    classes.add("Operating Systems");
044    classes.add("Java");
045    Student dave = new Student("Dave", classes, 3.65, "male");
046
047    assertThat(dave.toString(), equalTo("Dave has a GPA of 3.64 and is taking 3 classes: Algorithms, Operating Systems, and Java.  He says \"This class is too much work\"."));
048  }
049
050  @Test
051  void toStringContainsStudentName() {
052    String name = "Student";
053    Student student = createStudentNamed(name);
054    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString(name));
055  }
056
057  @Test
058  void toStringContainsGPA() {
059    double gpa = 3.5;
060    Student student = new Student("Any name", new ArrayList<>(), gpa, "Doesn't matter");
061    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString(" has a GPA of " + gpa));
062  }
063
064  @Test
065  void negativeGPAThrowsInvalidGPAException() {
066    double invalidGpa = -1.0;
067
068    Student.InvalidGPAException ex = assertThrows(Student.InvalidGPAException.class,
069      () -> new Student("Any name", new ArrayList<>(), invalidGpa, "Doesn't matter"));
070
071    assertThat(ex.getMessage(), containsString("Invalid GPA: " + invalidGpa));
072    assertThat(ex.getInvalidGPA(), equalTo(invalidGpa));
073  }
074
075}
